page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
LOCAL HISTORY STANTON HARCOURT {HARCOURT FAMILY}
The Harcourt Family came over to join King William just after 1066. One married Isabel de Courville and was given the Manor of Stanton as dowry. House subsequently built, and part remains today, the old domestic Kitchen, and Popes Tower a chapel with 4 rooms above - the Priest's living quarters. The tower was so called because the poet Alexander Pope lived there for some time.
The Harcourt Family have had connections with the village for 37 generations.
{CHURCH}This is a partly Norman building.
